jinngine.physics.constraint.joint
Interface JointAxisController

public interface JointAxisController

This interface should be retrieved from invoking methods on joint constraints. The interface can then be used to control the involved joint axis, like in a hinge joint. In that case, the positions, velocities, and limits will refer to angular quantities. This may not be the case for a sliding joint constraint, where the constraints on motion is linear in nature, so the quantities refer to linear constraints.

Author:
mo

Method Summary

          Returns joint's position on this axis.

          Return the joint velocity along this axis

          Set the available friction force magnitude for preventing motion along this joint axis
 void setLimits(double thetaMin, double thetaMax)
          Set the position limits for the joint along this joint axis.
 void setMotorForce(double force)
          Set the joint motor force.
 

Method Detail

getPosition

double getPosition()
Returns joint's position on this axis. In case of an angular axis, this is a value in the range (-PI, PI). In case of a linear axis, the value could be any real number.

Returns:

getVelocity

double getVelocity()
Return the joint velocity along this axis

Returns:

void setLimits(double thetaMin,
               double thetaMax)
Set the position limits for the joint along this joint axis.

thetaMin -
thetaMax -

setFrictionMagnitude

void setFrictionMagnitude(double magnitude)
Set the available friction force magnitude for preventing motion along this joint axis

Parameters:
magnitude -

setMotorForce

void setMotorForce(double force)
Set the joint motor force. Using the available force, the motor will try to accelerate the joint to the highest possible velocity. When this setting is non-zero, the friction force of this joint axis is turned off.

Parameters:
force -
